tool.name: OTB.VectorDataReprojection
tool.description: Reproject a vector data using support image projection reference, or a user specified map projection
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayin.vd False isArrayin.kwl False isArrayout.proj.image.in False isArrayelev.geoid False output_data_out.vd $output_data_out.vd name OTB.VectorDataReprojection in.vd $in.vd in.kwl $in.kwl out.proj $out.proj out.proj.image.in $out.proj.image.in out.proj.user.map $out.proj.user.map out.proj.user.map.utm.zone $out.proj.user.map.utm.zone out.proj.user.map.utm.northhem $out.proj.user.map.utm.northhem out.proj.user.map.epsg.code $out.proj.user.map.epsg.code elev.dem '$elev.dem' elev.geoid $elev.geoid elev.default $elev.default prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out.vd $OutputSection_out.vd.outputType_out.vd transmissionMode_out.vd $OutputSection_out.vd.transmissionMode_out.vd

param.name: in.vd
param.label: The input vector data to reproject
param.help: The input vector data to reproject The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, zip, json

param.name: in.kwl
param.label: Optional input image to fill vector data with image kwl.
param.help: Optional input image to fill vector data with image kwl. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, png, tiff

param.name: out.proj.image.in
param.label: Projection map will be found using image metadata
param.help: Projection map will be found using image metadata The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, png, tiff

param.name: out.proj.user.map
param.label: Defines the map projection to be used.
param.help: Defines the map projection to be used.

param.name: out.proj.user.map.utm.zone
param.label: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)
param.help: The zone number ranges from 1 to 60 and allows defining the transverse mercator projection (along with the hemisphere)

param.name: out.proj.user.map.utm.northhem
param.label: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.
param.help: The transverse mercator projections are defined by their zone number as well as the hemisphere. Activate this parameter if your image is in the northern hemisphere.

param.name: out.proj.user.map.epsg.code
param.label: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection
param.help: See www.spatialreference.org to find which EPSG code is associated to your projection

param.name: elev.dem
param.label: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.
param.help: This parameter allows selecting a directory containing Digital Elevation Model files. Note that this directory should contain only DEM files. Unexpected behaviour might occurs if other images are found in this directory.

param.name: elev.geoid
param.label: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd).
param.help: Use a geoid grid to get the height above the ellipsoid in case there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles. A version of the geoid can be found on the OTB website(https://gitlab.orfeo-toolbox.org/orfeotoolbox/otb-data/blob/master/Input/DEM/egm96.grd). The following data types are allowed in the txt file: octet-stream

param.name: elev.default
param.label: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.
param.help: This parameter allows setting the default height above ellipsoid when there is no DEM available, no coverage for some points or pixels with no_data in the DEM tiles, and no geoid file has been set. This is also used by some application as an average elevation value.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_out.vd
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_out.vd
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This application allows reprojecting a vector data using support image projection reference, or a user given map projection. If given, image keywordlist can be added to reprojected vectordata.
